abstract: Music industry has so far failed to produce broadly popular songs of protest despite tough economic times that are symbolized by Occupy Wall Street movement; radio airwaves continue to be dominated by lighthearted dance music, in stark contrast to previous periods of unrest.
snippet: The Occupy Wall Street protests may be spreading, but musicians continue to fill the airwaves with songs about dancing, not the worries of working people.
lead_paragraph: The Occupy Wall Street protests may be spreading, but musicians continue to fill the airwaves with songs about dancing, not the worries of working people.

headline.main: At the Protests, the Message Lacks a Melody
headline.print_headline: At the Protests, The Message Lacks a Melody
headline.seo: Occupy Wall Street Protest Lacks an Anthem
